title: New lease of life for Bedfordshire landmark used for Hollywood blockbusters
text:
Shed 1 at Cardington, Bedfordshire Credit: ITV News Anglia It's been the location for Hollywood blockbusters and home to the world's largest aircraft. Its also one of Bedfordshire's best known landmarks.
But despite it's historic past Shed 1 at Cardington near Bedford was for years at risk of collapse. Now though it's been given a new lease of life.
The official opening Credit: ITV News Anglia The cardington sheds were built for the airship industry just after the first world war.
Number 1 was home to the legendary R101, and although smaller the current airship being developed here is still the largest in the world.
"I could see when I was passing back and forth for 15 years that this shed was falling to bits. Something that was lost has been brought back.
â€“ Patrick Tattan, Owner of Shed 1, Cardington Shed 1 is a familiar sight on the Bedfordshire landscape Credit: ITV News Anglia That extraordinary size has seen it and neighbouring shed number 2 also make them the ideal location for film companies.
In recent years blockbusters including Batman 'The Dark Knight' and most recently 'Pan' have been shot on site.
Thats good news because along with it's historical status the shed will have to pay its way.
For years shed number 1 was on the English Heritage at risk register, now it will be removed.
No longer in danger of collapse this building from the past will play a key role in Bedfordshire's future.
